children.name: to find the answer or explanation to sth
solve
children.definition: to find the explanation to sth that is difficult to understand, for example a crime or a mystery: giải, giải thích, phá, làm sáng tỏ
examples: The role of the press is to sell newspapers, not to solve crime.
At last astronomers have solved the mystery of the rings encircling the planet Saturn.
These games encourage children’s ability to solve puzzles using their mathematical skills.
solve a crime/caseThe crime was never solved.
solve a murderPolice have called for witnesses to help them solve the murder.
solve a mysteryStaff at the library think they have solved the mystery.
solve a puzzleYou progress through the game by solving puzzles.
solve a riddleThey still haven't really solved the riddle of how the pyramids were built.
solve an equationAt the age of six, he could solve complicated mathematical equations.

children.name: find an explanation
children.definition: to find a way of explaining sth, especially after trying for a fairly long time:tìm ra một lời giải thích
examples: Sheena has had these stomach pains before, but the doctors think they have found an explanation this time.
find an explanation for
No one has been able to find a rational explanation for the ship’s sudden disappearance.

children.name: clear up
children.definition: to find the whole explanation for sth that is strange and difficult to understand, so that it is completely solved: làm rõ, làm sáng tỏ
examples: I was hoping that your research would clear up a question that has been bothering me.
Can you clear something up for us? How old are you?
The Dreyfus case was never completely cleared up. It remains a mystery.
They never cleared up themysteryof the missing money.
After twenty years, the case has finally been cleared up.

children.name: crack
children.definition: informalto find the explanation for something such as a crime or something that is difficult to understand, especially after trying for a long time: giải
examples: It’s a tough case but I’m determined to crack it.
Give Tom a mathematical puzzle and he’ll just keep on trying till he cracks it.
They cracked thecodeand read the secret message.
UKI've been trying to solve this problem all week, but I still haven't cracked it.

children.name: figure out
children.definition: / work outC2  to find the explanation for sth that is difficult to understand, by thinking carefully about it and using the information available to you:tìm ra, giải ra
examples: The police haven’t even managed to figure out a motive.
Don’t tell him the answer - let him work it out for himself.
figure out/work out how/why/what etc
My husband bought me a knitting machine for Christmas but I still haven’t figured out how itworks.
From the evidence gathered from witnesses we should be able to work out what happened that night.

children.name: unravel
children.definition: to gradually find the explanation for sth that is difficult to understand because it is very complicated:làm sáng tỏ, “tháo ra, gỡ ra”
examples: We are only just beginning to unravel the mysteries of the human brain.
Can scientists unravel the complex interactions of chemicals within foods?

children.name: when a problem or difficult situation is solved by itself
resolve itself
children.definition: if a complicated problem resolves itself, it either stops being a problem or is solved without you having to do anything:tự hết
examples: Fortunately, our employee problem resolved itself when two workers moved house and resigned voluntarily.
If we are patient the whole problem will resolve itself in due course.

children.name: work out
children.definition: if a problem or bad situation works out orworks itself out, it gradually gets solved without you having to do anything:được giải quyết, qua đi, tiến triển
examples: Try not to worry. I’m sure everything will work out in the end.
I’ve found that major problems tent to either go away or somehow work themselves out.
sort itself out
This situation is not going to sort itself out. We have to do something.
Childhood problems and anxieties have a habit of sorting themselves out.

children.name: unsolved
children.definition: a problem, mystery, or crime that is unsolved has never been solved :không được giải quyết
examples: All too often, crimes of violence are left unsolved.
What happened to the men on the expedition will always be an unsolved mystery.
The murder still remains unsolved.

children.name: unexplained
children.definition: an event or fact that is unexplained has never been explained so no one knows exactly what happened:không giải thích được
examples: For years, Sukhbir’s death remained unexplained.
There had been three unexplained fires at the school in the previous six months.

children.name: to successfully deal with a problem
cure
children.definition: to permanently solve a practical problem so that it does not happen again: “chữa trị”
examples: If your computer stops working, re-booting might cure the problem.
Beveridge believed that unemployment could be cured by state intervention.
Finance Ministers meet this week to discuss how to cure inflation.

children.name: solve
children.definition: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem →solution: giải quyết
examples: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
the best way of solving our dilemma
solve a problemHe solved the problem by moving the aggressive fish to a separate tank.
solve a crisisCongress had not been able to solve the financial crisis.
solve a dispute/conflictThey have agreed to solve their disputes solely by peaceful means.
solve a dilemmaCan you solve my dilemma?
solve sb’s difficultiesYou can't solve your difficulties by running away.
solve a questionDid they really think the Jerusalem question would be solved in a week?

children.name: resolve
children.definition: formal to successfully deal with a problem or unpleasant situation so that it no longer exists:giải quyết được, giải quyết xong
examples: Talking is the only way to resolve your differences.
It is difficult to see how this conflict can be resolved without taking the matter to court.
resolve a problem/crisis/situationAction is being taken to resolve the problem.
resolve a dispute/conflictNegotiation is the only way to resolve the dispute.
resolve an issue/matter/questionHas the issue been resolved yet?
resolve your differences(= stop arguing with each other )She and Rose had finally resolved their differences.
satisfactorilySome problems still hadn’t been satisfactorily resolved.
fully/completelyIt is a row that may never be fully resolved.
peacefullyWe wanted to resolve the situation peacefully.
amicably(= in a friendly way )We will always do our best to resolve complaints amicably.
quicklyThe matter was resolved quite quickly.
resolution[S or U] C2 formal when someone solves a problem, argument, or difficult situation
resolution of
a forum for the resolution of commercial disputes
a successful resolutiontothe crisis

children.name: put right
children.definition: to deal with an unsatisfactory situation, especially by making sure that any damage that has been caused is paid for, removed, stopped etc:
examples: There seems to be something wrong with the computer but we hope to put it right before too long.
If there is bullying in the classroom, it is the teacher who should put the problem right.
This government intends to put right everything that the last government did wrong.

children.name: remedy
children.definition: to deal with an unsatisfactory situation, especially an unfair one, so that the situation no longer exists or is greatly improved:khắc phục
examples: There have been several tragic rail accidents. The government must act quickly to remedy this situation.
Equal rights for women were necessary to remedy the injustices done to them over the centuries.

children.name: sort out
children.definition: to remove any problems or difficulties from a situation, especially before doing sth else:giải quyết
examples: I’m afraid I can’t help you until I’ve sorted my own problems out.
You can’t possibly start decorating yet. We haven’t sorted out the roof yet.
sort things out
There’s been a serious misunderstanding; I’ll try to sort things out and then I’ll phone youback.
get sth sorted out
I want to get everything sorted out before I leave.

children.name: sort
children.definition: Britishinformalto successfully deal with a problem:giải quyết
examples: Don’t worry about the money. I’ll sort it, OK?
You should be able to sort this without my help.

children.name: find a solution
children.definition: find/come up with a solution to think of a way to solve a problem, especially a complicated political or social problem:tìm ra một giải pháp
examples: Crime is rapidly increasing in our inner cities. We must find a solution.
Civil war seems increasingly likely unless the government comes up with a solution.
find/come up with a solution to
European governments are working together to find a solution to the problem of nuclear waste.

children.name: iron out
children.definition: to remove any small problems or difficulties before you start something, especially by discussing them, so that they do not cause problems later: giải quyết
examples: We need to iron a few things out before we move in together.
We decided it was best to iron out our differences at an early stage in the production.

children.name: not solved or difficult to solve
unresolved
children.definition: an unresolved problem or question has not been answered or solved :chưa giải quyết
examples: A number of problems are still unresolved.
The design of the new shopping mall is almost complete, although there are still some unresolved difficulties.
the unresolved issue of who will pay for the project
an unresolved conflict

children.name: insoluble
children.definition: formal an insoluble problem is very difficult or impossible to solve:không giải quyết được
examples: The government has to deal with what seems like an insoluble political problem - racial harmony within the community.
The cleaning-up operation after the oil spill will be difficult but not insoluble.

children.name: intractable
children.definition: formal an intractable problem is one that is so difficult and complicated that it is impossible to solve it however hard you try:khó giải quyết
examples: The disposal of toxic wastes is one of the most intractable problems facing industrialized societies.
the seemingly intractable problem of human greed

children.name: solution
children.definition: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation →solve:giải pháp
examples: The best solution would be for them to separate.
solution to/for
There are no simple solutions to the problem of overpopulation.
a good solutionA good solution is to harvest the crop early in September.
the best/perfect/ideal solutionLocking people in prison is not necessarily the ideal solution.
an effective solutionThe government has failed to come up with an effective solution.
a satisfactory solution(= good enough )We will not rest until a satisfactory solution is found.
a neat solution(= simple and clever )This sounded like a neat solution to the skills shortage.
the only solutionThe only solution is to greatly reduce our use of water.
the real solution(= the only good solution )The real solution to the waste problem is to produce much less waste.
a possible solutionThere are three possible solutions to this problem.
an alternative solutionWe need to look for alternative solutions.
a simple/easy solutionThere is no easy solution to this problem.
a quick/speedy solutionWe need to find a quick solution.
a practical/workable solution(= one that is really possible )They've had to find practical solutions to practical problems.
a long-term solution(= one that will be effective for a long time )A long-term solution to the problem will not be possible until that conflict is resolved.
a quick-fix solution(= one that solves a problem for a short time only )He has accused the government of looking for quick-fix solutions.
a peaceful/political solution(= one that does not involve fighting )We will continue to work strenuously for a political solution acceptable to all parties.
find/come up with a solutionWe are working together to find the best solution we can.
seek/look for a solutionThe company is still seeking a solution to its financial problems.
provide/offer a solutionI don't think that tourism will provide a long-term solution to rural employment problems.
suggest/put forward a solutionThe chairman put forward a possible solution.

children.name: cure
children.definition: a way of dealing with a problem, especially a practical problem, so that it does not happen again:giải pháp, phép điều trị
examples: ▪ The experts believe they know the causes of the crime wave but they cannot agree on a cure.
cure for
▪ Adding a little oil into the mechanism is one of the best cures for a noisy engine.
miracle/wonder curea very effective cure
▪ It’s not a miracle cure, but moisturiser can make your skin less dry.

children.name: remedy
children.definition: a way of dealing with a problem or unsatisfactory situation by improving it or getting rid of it completely:phương thuốc
examples: If you find it hard to live on your present salary, the best remedy would be to change jobs.
remedy for
One remedy for racial attacks would be to educate our children more about social issues.

children.name: answer
children.definition: a way of dealing with a problem or unsatisfactory situation, especially one that has been worrying you for a long time:câu trả lời
examples: The city council has to find a better way of dealing with domestic waste. One answer is to burn it.
simple/easy/obvious answer
There is no simple answer.
answer to
The police do not have an answer to rising crime.
Some people think cars should be banned from the city, but I don’t think that’s the answer.
be the answer to sb’s problems/worries etc
If he could get a job it’d be the answer to all his worries.
there are no easy answers:
There are no easy answers to today’s environmental problems.
the simple/easy answerThere are a lot of problems and no simple answers.
the obvious answerThe obvious answer is to raise taxes, but that would be unpopular.
the perfect answerI think I have the perfect answer to the problem.
the complete answerA loan, however, is not the complete answer to the company’s problems.
the long-term answerHe believes hydrogen is the long-term answer to our growing energy crisis.
a short-term answerEmploying overseas nurses is only a short-term answer to the shortage.
have an answerDoctors are supposed to have all the answers.
find an answerThe aim is to find a long-term answer to poverty.
come up with an answer(= find a way of dealing with a problem )The government is struggling to come up with answers to our economic problems.

children.name: panacea
children.definition: formalsomething that people hope will solve all their problems:thuốc chữa bách bệnh
examples: ▪ Electoral reform is not a panacea. It causes almost as many problems as it solves.
panacea for
▪ Librarians welcomed computerization as the panacea for all their cataloguing problems.

children.name: way out
children.definition: a way of dealing with an unpleasant situation so that it no longer exists: lối thoát
examples: ▪ We are faced with a very difficult situation, but there must be a way out.
way out of
▪ I don’t see any way out of the present deadlock.

children.name: solve
children.definition: /sɒlvǁsɑːlv, sɔːlv/  if someone solves acrimeor amystery, they get all the information they need so that they can explain exactly what happened :
examples: phá ( án ), tìm ra
▪ Detectives are trying to solve the murder of a young girl.
Các thám tử đang tìm cách phá án vụ giết hại một cô gái trẻ.
▪ Officials hope the Navy will solve the mystery of four bombs that are missing from the wreckage of a military jet.
Các quan chức hy vọng Hải quân sẽ giải quyết được sự mất tích bí ẩn của bốn quả bom trong đống đổ nát của một máy bay quân sự.

children.name: clue
children.definition: nounđầu mối; manh mối
examples: a sign or some information which helps you to find the answer to a problem, question ormystery
_Police are stilllooking forclues in their search for the missing girl.
_I'm never going to guess the answer if you don'tgiveme a clue.
